articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: More than 40,000 fans and an all-star line-up of rock legends pay homage at the "heavy metal Live Aid".
articles.title: Ozzy Osbourne and Black Sabbath go out on a high at farewell gig

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The world's richest man says he is setting up a new political organisation called the America Party.
articles.title: Elon Musk says he is launching new political party

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Some 27 children are missing from a girls' summer camp on the banks of the river, say officials in Kerr County.
articles.title: Texas flood: Frantic search for survivors of deluge that killed 32, including 14 children

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The funeral of footballers Diogo Jota and André Silva dominate the front pages of Sunday's papers
articles.title: Newspaper headlines: 'You'll never walk alone' and 'swept away'

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Police say paramedics called to the line near Poynton in Cheshire were unable to save the teenagers.
articles.title: Poynton police find bodies of two boys, 16, on railway line

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The community in Gondomar grieves after the deaths of Liverpool star Diogo Jota and his brother, André Silva.
articles.title: Diogo Jota and André Silva's funeral held in Portugal

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A trail of suspicious wills led to an organised gang committing fraud and stealing millions from dead people's estates.
articles.title: How fake-will fraudsters steal millions from the dead

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: What’s gone wrong for Labour? 2024 voters delve into it, writes Laura Kuenssberg.
articles.title: Labour might be down, but it's not necessarily out - voters reflect on a year in power

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Political scientists have a term for the tactic, that has been used by some leaders including Nixon, to persuade adversaries that they are temperamentally capable of anything, to extract concessions. But can it work in the long term?
articles.title: How Trump is using the 'Madman Theory' to try to change the world

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Benjamin Netanyahu says Hamas is seeking changes to a proposal for a ceasefire deal that Israel has accepted.
articles.title: Israel to send team to Gaza talks despite Hamas demands, PM says
